g.title: fundamentals
g.text: Easy to contribute to the compiler
Extending language possible by mere humans
Compiler libraries for MIR, types, traits

g.title: core-lang
g.text: Easy to contribute to the compiler
Dynamic dispatch (dyn trait) more powerful, easier to use

g.title: dev-tooling
g.text: Able to understand programs in terms of async behavior
Able to fix correctness problems in development environment
Able to fix performance problems in development environment
Rust well integrated into common IDEs
Profilers for CPU and memory usage

g.title: high-assurance
g.text: Developers extending Rust with unsafe Rust can prove these extensions correct
Developers can prove their Rust code meets functional specifications
Developers can prove their Rust code meets specification
Sanitizer / dynamic checker for unsafe code

g.title: async-lang
g.text: Using Async I/O comparable in complexity to Sync I/O
Can author and use async libraries without thinking about runtimes
Access to a wide variety of useful libraries on crates.io
Easy to create and experiment with a specialized runtime
Full support for io-uring and other high performance primitives
Async resource cleanup works well (async drop)
I/O uring support in tokio, other runtimes

g.title: onboarding-time
g.text: Time to be highly productive is measured in months
Clear transition paths from other major languages

g.title: well-integrated-into-internet-services
g.text: Rust is well integrated into internet services
SDKs for interacting with web services are readily available and complete
FaaS platforms have first-class, convenient support for Rust

g.title: goal-internet-services
g.text: ðŸŽ¯ Rust a common choice for internet services
Operating costs and carbon impact are reduced
Rate of vulnerabilities and high priority errors is reduced
Rust a common choice for building internet services
Rust a common choice for code that runs on internet services

g.title: goal-embedded
g.text: ðŸŽ¯ Rust a common choice for embedded applications

g.title: prod-tooling
g.text: Able to troubleshoot correctness problems that arise in production
Able to troubleshoot performance problems that arise in production
